intro: Acridocarpus vivy var. glandulifer, commonly known as the glandular vivy. This variant is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in shaded, humid environments.
